prompt: $G$ is a tree graph with root node $r$. $M_1$ and $M_2$ are MECs (both obey \cref{item-1-of-thm:nes-and-suf-cond-for-tree-graph-to-be-an-MEC,item-2-of-thm:nes-and-suf-cond-for-tree-graph-to-be-an-MEC} of \cref{thm:nes-and-suf-cond-for-tree-graph-to-be-an-MEC}) with skeleton $G$. $M_1$ belongs to $\setofMECs{G, r, 1}$ as there is an edge $a\rightarrow r$ incoming towards $r$. $M_2$ belongs to $\setofMECs{G, r, 0}$ as none of the edges adjacent to $r$ in $M_2$ is incoming towards $r$. $M_2$ also belongs to $\setofMECs{G, r, 0, 1}$ as it belongs to $\setofMECs{G, r, 0}$ and one edge adjacent to $r$ in $M_2$ is undirected.
